briefdescription.para: Enumerated types to be used for interpreting formats.
Structure containing information about an ASCII table.
Create a regex from a character array. Adapted from https://www.lemoda.net/c/unix-regex/.

parameterdescription.para: pointer to regex_t. Resutling regex expression.
constant character pointer to text that should be compiled.

simplesect.para: static int Success or failure of compilation.

briefdescription.para: Count the number of times a regular expression is matched in a string.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be compiled into a regex.
constant character pointer to string that should be checked for matches.

simplesect.para: int Number of matches found. -1 is returned if the regex could not be compiled.

briefdescription.para: Count how many % format specifiers there are in format string. Formats are found by counting the number of matches to the regular expression adapted from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/446285/validate-sprintf-format-from-input-field-with-regex.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to string that should be searched for format specifiers.

simplesect.para: int Number of format specifiers found.

briefdescription.para: Open the file.

parameterdescription.para: asciiTable_t table structure.

briefdescription.para: Close the file.

parameterdescription.para: asciiTable_t table structure.

briefdescription.para: Read a line from the file and parse it.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
va_list Pointers to variables where parsed arguments should be stored.

simplesect.para: int On success, the number of characters read. -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Format arguments to form a line and write it to the file.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
va_list Variables that should be formatted using the format string to create a line in the table.

simplesect.para: int On success, the number of characters written. -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Read a line from the file and parse it.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
Pointers to variables where parsed arguments should be stored.

simplesect.para: int On success, the number of characters read. -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Format arguments to form a line and write it to the file.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
Variables that should be formatted using the format string to create a line in the table.

simplesect.para: int On success, the number of characters written. -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Write the format string the the file, prepending it with a comment.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.

simplesect.para: int On success, the number of characters written. -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Try to find the format string in the file. The format string is assumed to start with a comment.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.

briefdescription.para: Set the number of columns by counting the format specifiers.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.

simplesect.para: int The number of columns counted. Negative values indicate errors.

briefdescription.para: Determine the column types by parsing the format string.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.

simplesect.para: int 0 on success, -1 on failure. TODO: switch to regex

memberdef.argsstring: (const asciiTable_t t, const char *data, const int data_siz, va_list ap)
memberdef.name: at_vbytes_to_array

briefdescription.para: Convert data into arrays for columns.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
constant character pointer to memory containing data that should be parsed.
constant int Size of data in bytes.
va_list Pointers to pointers to memory where columns should be stored.

simplesect.para: int Number of rows read on success, -1 on failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const asciiTable_t t, char **data, int nrows, va_list ap)
memberdef.name: at_varray_to_bytes

briefdescription.para: Encode a set of arrays as bytes.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
Pointer to pointer to memory where encoded arrays should be stored. It does not need to be allocate, only declared.
int Number of rows in each column array.
va_list Pointers to memory where column data is stored.

briefdescription.para: Convert data into arrays for columns.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
constant character pointer to memory containing data that should be parsed.
constant int Size of data in bytes.
Pointers to pointers to memory where columns should be stored.

simplesect.para: int Number of rows read on success, -1 on failure.

briefdescription.para: Encode a set of arrays as bytes.

parameterdescription.para: constant asciiTable_t table structure.
Pointer to pointer to memory where encoded arrays should be stored. It does not need to be allocate, only declared.
int Number of rows in each column array.
Pointers to memory where column data is stored.

briefdescription.para: Deallocate and clean up asciiTable_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: asciiTable_t table structure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const char *filepath, const char *io_mode, const char *format_str, const char *comment, const char *column, const char *newline)
memberdef.name: asciiTable

briefdescription.para: Constructor for asciiTable_t structure.

parameterdescription.para: constant character pointer to file path.
constant character pointer to I/O mode. "r" for read, "w" for write.
constant character pointer to string describing the format of the table roads. Required for io_mode == "w", but if set to NULL for io_mode == "r", it will attempt to be read from the table.
const character pointer to character(s) that should indicate a comment. If NULL, comment is set to "# ".
const character pointer to character(s) that should separate columns in the table. If NULL, column is set to "\t".
const character pointer to character(s) that should indicate a newline. If NULL, newline is set to "\n".
